author: funnygiulio
content: Hi, i have a question about the on_block function in the CL spec: why are we rejecting slots on the future, is it because we reverse-download from the latest finalized or does "from the future" mean in a future epoch?

author: potuz
content:
Sorry what is the `on_block` function in the CL spec? I know of an `onBlock` function in prysm, but perhaps you are referring to the P2P specs:
```
[IGNORE] The block is not from a future slot (with a MAXIMUM_GOSSIP_CLOCK_DISPARITY allowance) -- i.e. validate that signed_beacon_block.message.slot <= current_slot (a client MAY queue future blocks for processing at the appropriate slot).
```
Which indeed says that we do not gossip blocks from the future, but we may keep them (and we do) to validate later on when its their time
